article.headline: Colgate 67, Lafayette 66 (OT)
article.story: UPPER MARLBORO, Md. (AP)-- Mark Linebaugh's jumper with 18.7 seconds to play in overtime lifted Colgate to a 67-66 win over Lafayette on Saturday in the Patriot League quarterfinals. The sixth-seeded Raiders (15-13) will face second-seeded American in Sunday's second semifinal. The Eagles advanced in much easier fashion, 65-48, over Army. Colgate, which was won its third straight, took a 67-64 lead on Linebaugh's jumper only to have the Leopards (18-10) cut it to one on a layup by Mike Farrell, who scored six of his 10 in overtime. Alvin Reed missed a free throw with 7.7 seconds left to give Justin DeBerry one last rush to the basket, but his potential game-winning shot through traffic was short. DeBerry scored 17 to lead Lafayette. Howard Blue led the Raiders with 17 points and 11 rebounds, while Andrew Zidar scored 16. The two teams were tied 30-all at halftime, and neither team led by more than seven in the second half. Colgate, which took 75 shots from the floor and grabbed 24 offensive rebounds, led 56-53 with 38 seconds left in regulation. However, Winston Davis sent the game into overtime with a 3-pointer from the corner with 25 seconds to play.
